sub-events.comment: By having an intended scale and gradually moving the actual layer scale towards that value, we can create a smooth zoom based on the car's speed.
The 9.2 controls how much zoom when the car is stationary
The 22 controls how much zoom in / zoom out when the car is accelerating and capped at their top speed
The 0.75 controls how delayed to actual zoom is
Adjust the division factor in Speed / 280 to control overall shake sensitivity
The 0.008 and 0.01 in the ShakeIntensity lerp controls how quickly the shake fades in/out
Lower values (like 0.05) make it fade more slowly
Higher values (like 0.2) make it fade more quickly
The 0.07 in the offset lerps controls the shake movement smoothness
Lower values make the shake more fluid but less responsive
Higher values make the shake more immediate but possibly jerkier
The -0.008 is the Attenuation Factor, it controls how sensitive it is to the distance
A larger negative value (e.g., -0.009) = sharper volume drop-off (more sensitive).
A smaller negative value (e.g., -0.006) = gentler volume drop-off (less sensitive).

action.name: Set value
action.param: "Ribarii: Hey, where are we going. You we're supposed to park my car. Go back"

action.param: "Use WASD or Arrow Keys to move the car"

action.param: "Ribarii: He's slowing down on a corner, QUICK IT'S NOW OR NEVERR!!"

action.param: "Ribarii: C'MON THIS IS OUR ONLY CHANCE"

action.param: "Ribarii: Ah, after this turn, it's straight roads only. You might lose him"

action.param: "Ribarii: Yes, you did it, you made him stopped!"

action.param: "Ribarii: I think that's them, quick full throttle ahead"
